page.title: 14MULTICULTURAL S.E.LUTON
page.content: Many families who moved to England from other countries eventually settled in S.E. Luton. This century the main immigrant groups have been from Ireland, the Caribbean and Asia, (especially Pakistan and Bangladesh). This injection of different cultures, religions, accents and languages has changed the area into a multicultural society. In Bury Park is located a mosque,built by the Muslim community. This area also contains a number of shops and restaurants specialising in Asian food. At Stockwood High School, which serves most of the area, a survey of languages spoken by pupils in Years 1 to 3 revealed Arabic, Bengali,Cantonese,Danish,English, Gujerati,Italian,Punjabi,Swedish, Turkish,and Urdu.
